content:
Here is the latest version of the TestScript (v4). I've split the previous consolidated script into two separate scenarios:

  • Patient Corrections without Structured Data (HIPAA flow, Task, replaces paper workflows)
  • Patient Corrections with Structured Data (assumes PatientPortal or PHR, and patient has downloaded their data)

At this point in time, I'm not looking for suggestions to split the document apart. We have participants expressing different interests and goals, and we need both scenarios to successfully explore this topic during the connectathon. That being said, suggestions on improving the document are welcomed and encouraged.

@Mario Hyland @Richard Ettema - I've talked with both of you about a crash course on writing test scripts on Touchstone. Can I finally take you up on that offer with the following?

PatientCorrection_WithAndWithoutStructuredData_Touchstone_TestScript_v4.pdf
Patient Corrections using Task can have structured data by placing the structured data as inputs in the task. Using Task does not mean the data won't be structured. It means it doesn't have to be.
